definition: presentable/decent/up to par
to resemble/to be like/to look as if/such as/appearance/image/portrait/image under a mapping (math.)
manner/pattern/way/appearance/shape/classifier: kind, type
solemn/presentable/decent
in no shape to be seen/unpresentable/beyond recognition

sentences.english: There isn't even a decent table in this room.
sentences.chinese: 这屋里连张像样的桌子也没有。

sentences.english: There isa reason every decent band tours.
sentences.chinese: 这就是每一个像样的乐队都巡演的原因。

sentences.english: And her homework was covered in bites and hoof prints.
sentences.chinese: 她的作业本被啃得不像样，而且还被踩满了蹄印。

sentences.english: I suggest you take them to a decent French restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 我建议你带他们去一家像样的法国餐厅。

sentences.english: This skirt is in poor shape.
I was a decent gift giver when we were dating.
sentences.chinese: 我们约会那会儿我是一个像样的送礼专家。

sentences.english: Please excuse this _ apology for a meal.
sentences.chinese: 请包涵这顿不像样的饭菜。

sentences.english: The roughly made bed on which he was born had no proper sheets and blankets.
sentences.chinese: 他出生的那张粗造滥制的床上没有像样的床单或毯子。

sentences.english: The animal is bald and mangy; it's an apology for a dog.
sentences.chinese: 这牲畜光秃秃的，浑身污秽，真是一条不像样的狗。

sentences.english: At that time, people were very poor, and even did not have a stick to their back.
sentences.chinese: 那时候，人们很穷，甚至连件像样的衣服都没有。

sentences.english: Our relationship had become so etiolated and dull thatwe didn't even have proper fights.
sentences.chinese: 我们的关系乏味到了我们都不能有一次像样的争吵。

sentences.english: at least, I'd been given a decent advance and money from foreign rights, too—it was a dream!
sentences.chinese: 至少，我可以拿到像样的预付金了，还有外国版权。

sentences.english: He also makes a decent chicken piccata.
sentences.chinese: 他还做得一手像样的溜鸡片。

sentences.english: It's hard to make a decent living as a musician.
sentences.chinese: 音乐家赚的钱难以过像样的生活。

sentences.english: So, get yourself a decent rice cooker.
sentences.chinese: 所以，给自己买个像样的电饭煲吧。

sentences.english: Yet in these times he might have done much worse.
sentences.chinese: 然则时至今日，也许更不像样。

definition: serious/earnest/real/true
wretched/poverty-stricken/unpresentable (for clothing, gifts etc)
to be nothing to write home about (idiom)
to keep up appearances/to put up a front
to do with difficulty/to force sb to do sth/reluctant/barely enough
simple and crude
with great difficulty/very difficult
haven't/hasn't/doesn't exist/to not have/to not be
it is a pity/what a pity/unfortunately
luckily/fortunately
at the minimum/at the very least
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
surname Lian
to hope for sth/to count on/hope
not presentable/shoddy and too embarrassing to show
acceptable/passable/justifiable/(of a course of action) to make sense
lack/shortage of/shortfall/to be short (of)/to lack
